title: Harvard faces an attendance problem — are students taking on too much?
author: Frances Klemm

title: Boston City Council to explore publicly-owned grocery stores
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Rising prices and impending SNAP disruptions mean that a discussion about publicly-owned grocery stores is more necessary than ever, some officials say.

Craig F.

title: Martha’s Vineyard babysitter pleads not guilty in toddler’s death
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime On Tuesday, the Oak Bluffs woman pleaded not guilty in Dukes County Superior Court.

An Oak Bluffs babysitter charged with manslaughter after allegedly leaving a toddler unattended in her car, where he developed hypothermia and later died, pleaded not guilty Tuesday in Dukes County Superior Court, according to court documents and a local news outlet.
Aimee Cotton, 40, is charged with manslaughter and reckless endangerment of a child, according to court documents.

title: Mass. man found guilty of luring neighbor to his home in an attempt to rape her
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The man used "a ruse that he needed assistance booking a hotel room because his mother had died," prosecutors say.
A Level 3 sex offender from Taunton was found guilty on multiple charges last week after prosecutors say he lured a neighbor to his home in August 2023 in an attempt to rape her.

In Fall River Superior Court on Friday, Patrick Pesante, 49, was convicted of assault with intent to rape, indecent assault and battery on a person over 14, and kidnapping, according to the Bristol County District Attorney’s Office.

title: Report: Bill Belichick discussing buyout options with North Carolina

title: Netflix’s ‘Monster’ series is taking on Lizzie Borden in Season 4
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Streaming Ryan Murphy's popular Netflix anthology series will tackle Lizzie Borden in Season 4, and has cast the actress who will play the infamous Fall River woman.
Ella Beatty (L) will play infamous Fall River woman Lizzie Borden (R) in Season 4 of Ryan Murphy's Netflix anthology series "Monster.
" Evan Agostini/AP; AP File Photo By Kevin Slane October 8, 2025 | 2:50 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Tom Brady sneaks the Patriots into his top 10 teams in the NFL
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: New England Patriots Brady releases his NFL power rankings each week, and he included New England as his 10th ranked team for Week 5.
Tom Brady at the unveiling of his statue outside Gillette Stadium (Charles Krupa).
Tom Brady is settling into the next stage of his career as an NFL analyst for FOX Sports, a job which includes posting his top 10 teams in the league each week.

title: Man charged in shooting deaths of his sister-in-law and her daughter in N.H.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Charles "Chuck" Readey, 73, is facing two counts of second-degree murder.
A 73-year-old man was charged Tuesday following the shooting deaths of his sister-in-law and her daughter in Bath, New Hampshire.
Local police responded to a report of shots fired at 11 Tyler Way around 1:15 p.
